intro: Calliandra blanchetii, commonly known as the pink calliandra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery, pink to red flower clusters. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its showy blooms and ability to thrive in warm, sunny climates. Calliandra blanchetii is also valued for its nitrogen-fixing capability, which benefits soil fertility.
